Guru Berperan Penting Bagi Perkembangan Generasi Penerus
03 Nov 2019, 03:18 by Siska Nirmala
BOGOR, (PR).- Dekan Fakultas MIPA IPB University Dr Sri Nurdiati menyatakan pentingnya peran guru bagi perkembangan generasi bangsa Indonesia melalui pendidikan formal di sekolah maupun di luar sekolah.
"Sebagai guru kita berkesempatan untuk menyiapkan generasi lebih baik. Harapannya siswa kita menjadi pemimpin-pemimpin bangsa ini di masa mendatang. Mari kita persiapkan para siswa dengan baik," kata Dr Sri Nurdiati di Bogor, Minggu, 3 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Sri Nurdiati juga mengingatkan, pada semester genap sangat penting bagi siswa kelas XII untuk mempersiapkan diri menyongsong jenjang pendidikan selanjutnya. "Guru harus terus giat membesarkan dan menyiapkan siswa untuk masuk ke perguruan tinggi," kata dosen di Departemen Matematika ini.
Sebelumnya, Badan Eksekutif Mahasiswa Fakultas MIPA IPB University mengadakan kegiatan seminar keguruan untuk meningkatkan peran guru-guru Sekolah Menengah Atas (SMA) di Indonesia.
Kegiatan ini merupakan salah satu rangkaian dari Pesta Sains Nasional di IPB University yang dihadiri oleh siswa dan guru dari berbagai daerah di Indonesia. Seminar yang diselenggarakan di Auditorium Comon Class Room, Kampus IPB Dramaga, Bogor, Sabtu, 2 November 2019 tersebut untuk memotivasi dan mensosialisasikan sistem pembelajaran yang sesuai untuk generasi milenial.
Kegiatan ini diikuti sebanyak 270 peserta yakni guru SMA dari berbagai provinsi di Indonesia. Kegiatan ini menghadirkan pemateri Founder motivasipendidikan.com, Namin AB Ibnu Solihin. Namin adalah praktisi dan profesional di bidang motivasi pendidik. Hadir juga Dekan FMIPA IPB University Sri Nurdiati.
Menurut Namin, metode pembelajaran perlu perubahan untuk menyesuaikan siswa generasi milenial. Guru diharapkan bisa menjadi pendidik sekaligus teman belajar yang dekat dengan siswa, melalui berbagai macam inovasi agar siswa nyaman dengan suasana pembelajaran.
Guru saat ini, kata dia, harus juga bisa dekat dengan teknologi informasi, menggunakan media sosial sebagai salah satu metode pembelajaran, misalnya menggunakan video, fun game, ice breaking, sharing, dan lainnya. "Improvisasi dalam pembelajaran agar murid bisa terus fokus," katanya.
Pembicara berikutnya adalah peraih penghargaan Guru Era Baru Award Indonesia 2012 Â Dedi Dwitagama. Dedi turut mendorong guru menjadi pengajar milenial, misalnya dengan memberikan tugas-tugas milenial. "Guru bisa bisa memberikan tugas membuat konten blog dan mengunggah vlog di youtube untuk tugas pelajaran, yang mudah diterima siswa milenial," katanya.***

Teachers play an important role in the development of the next generation
03 Nov 2019, 03:18 by Siska Nirmala
BOGOR, (PR) .- Dean of the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences IPB University Dr. Sri Nurdiati stated the importance of the role of the teacher for the development of the generation of the Indonesian nation through formal education in school and outside school.
"As teachers we have the opportunity to prepare a better generation. Hopefully our students will become the leaders of this nation in the future. Let's prepare the students well," said Dr Sri Nurdiati in Bogor, Sunday, November 3, 2019, as reported by the News Agency Among.
Sri Nurdiati also reminded, in the even semester it is very important for students of class XII to prepare themselves to welcome the next level of education. "Teachers must continue to actively raise and prepare students to enter college," said the lecturer in the Department of Mathematics.
Previously, the Student Executive Board of the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences IPB University held teacher training seminars to enhance the role of high school (SMA) teachers in Indonesia.
This activity is one of a series of National Science Festivals at IPB University which was attended by students and teachers from various regions in Indonesia. The seminar, which was held at the Comon Class Room Auditorium, Dramaga Campus of IPB, Bogor, Saturday, November 2, 2019, was to motivate and socialize learning systems that are appropriate for millennials.
This activity was attended by 270 participants namely high school teachers from various provinces in Indonesia. This activity presented a presenter on motivationpendukasi.com, Namin AB Ibnu Solihin. Namin is a practitioner and professional in the area of motivational educators. Also present was the Dean of the Faculty of Mathematics and Natural Sciences, IPB University Sri Nurdiati.
According to Namin, the learning method needs to change to match millennial generation students. The teacher is expected to be an educator as well as a close learning partner with students, through various kinds of innovations so that students are comfortable with the learning atmosphere.
The current teacher, he said, must also be close to information technology, using social media as a method of learning, for example using video, fun games, ice breaking, sharing, and others. "Improvisation in learning so that students can continue to focus," he said.
The next speaker was the winner of the 2012 Indonesian New Era Award Teacher, Dedi Dwitagama. Dedi also encouraged teachers to become millennial teachers, for example by providing millennial assignments. "Teachers can provide assignments to create blog content and upload vlogs on YouTube for lesson assignments, which are easily accepted by millennial students," he said. ***
